name: durham
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(also Durham City, uk/ˌdʌr.əm ˈsɪt.i/ us/ˌdɜ˞.əm ˈsɪt̬.i/) a city in northeastern England: She is studying at Durham University. The fire service reported flooding in Durham City.
More examplesFewer examplesHis family has been living in Durham for 40 years.Have you ever been to Durham Cathedral?She was sent to Durham Prison for a month.

(also County Durham, uk/ˌkaʊn.ti ˈdʌr.əm/ us/ˌkaʊn.t̬i ˈdɜ˞.əm/) a county (= an area with its own local government) in northeastern England: The county of Durham is steeped in history. At first, we lived in County Durham, in the new town of Peterlee.
More examplesFewer examplesJack was a native of Crook in County Durham.They live in the County Durham village of Neasham. The Local Government Commission is considering how the people of the counties of Durham and Cleveland should be served by their local authorities.
